cards.name: Tundra Wolves
cards.text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor:
"I heard their eerie howling, the wolves calling their kindred across the frozen plains."
—Onean scout
cards.originalText: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.name: Venerable Monk
cards.text: When Venerable Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: Age wears the flesh but galvanizes the soul.
cards.originalText: When Venerable Monk comes into play, you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Voice of All
cards.text:
Flying
As Voice of All enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Voice of All has protection from the chosen color.
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
As Voice of All comes into play, choose a color. 
Voice of All has protection from the chosen color. (It can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything of the chosen color.)

cards.name: Wall of Swords
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
cards.flavor: The air hummed with the scissoring sound of uncounted blades that hovered in front of the invaders as though wielded by a phalanx of unseen hands.
cards.originalText: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Warrior's Honor
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The day will come when the righteous warrior faces a battle she cannot win. She will greet that day as she has any other."
—Asmira, holy avenger

rulings.text: Warrior's Honor affects creatures you control that are on the battlefield at the time it resolves. If you put a creature onto the battlefield later in the turn, that creature won't get the bonus.

cards.originalText: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Wild Griffin
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"I abandoned my dream of a squadron of griffin-riders when the cost proved too high. Three trainers were eaten for every griffin broken to the bridle."
—King Darien of Kjeldor
cards.originalText: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.name: Windborn Muse
cards.text:
Flying
Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature they control that's attacking you.
cards.flavor:
"Her voice is justice, clear and relentless."
—Akroma, angelic avenger

rulings.text: If you have more than one of these on the battlefield, the cost is cumulative.
In the Two-Headed Giant format, you still only have to pay once per creature.
Unless some effect explicitly says otherwise, a creature that can't attack you can still attack a planeswalker you control.

cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature he or she controls that's attacking you.

cards.name: Wrath of God
cards.text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Youthful Knight
cards.text: First strike
cards.flavor: Idealism fits him better than his armor.
cards.originalText: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.name: Academy Researchers
cards.text: When Academy Researchers enters the battlefield, you may put an Aura card from your hand onto the battlefield attached to Academy Researchers.
cards.flavor: They brandish their latest theories as warriors would wield weapons.

rulings.text: You can't put an Aura card from your hand onto the battlefield this way if that Aura can't legally enchant Academy Researchers. For example, you can't put an Aura with "enchant land" or "enchant green creature" onto the battlefield attached to Academy Researchers (unless Academy Researchers somehow turned into a land or a green creature before the ability resolved).

cards.originalText: When Academy Researchers comes into play, you may put an Aura card from your hand into play attached to Academy Researchers.

cards.name: Air Elemental
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor:
"The East Wind, an interloper in the dominions of Westerly Weather, is an impassive-faced tyrant with a sharp poniard held behind his back for a treacherous stab."
—Joseph Conrad, The Mirror of the Sea
cards.originalText: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.name: Ambassador Laquatus
cards.text: {3}: Target player puts the top three cards of their library into their graveyard.
cards.flavor: "Life is a game. The only thing that matters is whether you're a pawn or a player."
cards.originalText: {3}: Target player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Arcanis the Omnipotent
cards.text:
{T}: Draw three cards.
{2}{U}{U}: Return Arcanis the Omnipotent to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: "Do not concern yourself with my origin, my race, or my ancestry. Seek my record in the pits, and then make your wager."

rulings.text: Arcanis's last ability can only be activated while it's on the battlefield.

foreignNames.name: 全能なる者アルカニス

cards.originalText:
{T}: Draw three cards.
{2}{U}{U}: Return Arcanis the Omnipotent to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Aura Graft
cards.text: Gain control of target Aura that's attached to a permanent. Attach it to another permanent it can enchant.
cards.flavor: "It's not really stealing. It's more like extended borrowing."

rulings.text: If there is no legal place to move the enchantment, then it doesn't move but you still control it.
Aura Graft's effect has no duration. You'll retain control of the Aura until the game ends, the Aura leaves the battlefield, or an effect causes someone else to gain control of the Aura.
You can target an Aura you already control just to move that Aura to a new permanent.

cards.originalText: Gain control of target Aura that's attached to a permanent. Attach it to another permanent it can enchant.

cards.name: Aven Fisher
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Aven Fisher dies, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: The same spears that catch their food today will defend their homes tomorrow.
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.) 
When Aven Fisher is put into a graveyard from play, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Aven Windreader
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{1}{U}: Target player reveals the top card of their library.
cards.flavor: "The tiniest ripple tells a story ten fathoms deep."
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{1}{U}: Target player reveals the top card of his or her library.

cards.name: Boomerang
cards.text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Early Jamuraan hunters devised a weapon that would return to its source. Tolarian Æthermancers developed a spell that skipped the weapon entirely.
cards.originalText: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Cancel
cards.text: Counter target spell.
cards.originalText: Counter target spell.

cards.name: Cephalid Constable
cards.text: Whenever Cephalid Constable deals combat damage to a player, return up to that many target permanents that player controls to their owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Cephalids don't police people. They police loyalties.
cards.originalText: Whenever Cephalid Constable deals combat damage to a player, return up to that many target permanents that player controls to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Clone
cards.text: You may have Clone enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield.

rulings.text: If the chosen creature is copying something else (for example, if the chosen creature is another Clone), then your Clone enters the battlefield as whatever the chosen creature copied.
If the chosen creature is a token, Clone copies the original characteristics of that token as stated by the effect that put it onto the battlefield. Clone is not a token.

Any enters-the-battlefield abilities of the copied creature will trigger when Clone enters the battlefield. Any "as [this creature] enters the battlefield" or "[this creature] enters the battlefield with" abilities of the chosen creature will also work.
If the chosen creature has {X} in its mana cost (such as Protean Hydra), X is considered to be zero.

Clone copies exactly what was printed on the original creature and nothing more (unless that creature is copying something else or is a token; see below). It doesn't copy whether that creature is tapped or untapped, whether it has any counters on it or Auras attached to it, or any non-copy effects that have changed its power, toughness, types, color, or so on.
If Clone somehow enters the battlefield at the same time as another creature, Clone can't become a copy of that creature. You may choose only a creature that's already on the battlefield.
You can choose not to copy anything. In that case, Clone enters the battlefield as a 0/0 Shapeshifter creature, and is probably put into the graveyard immediately.
Clone's ability doesn't target the chosen creature.

cards.originalText: As Clone comes into play, you may choose a creature in play. If you do, Clone comes into play as a copy of that creature.

cards.name: Cloud Elemental
cards.text:
Flying
Cloud Elemental can block only creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: The soratami surround their sky-castles with living clouds that serve as both sword and shield.
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Cloud Elemental can block only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Cloud Sprite
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Cloud Sprite can block only creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: The delicate sprites carry messages for Saprazzans, but they refuse to land in Mercadia City's filthy markets.
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Cloud Sprite can block only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Counsel of the Soratami
cards.text: Draw two cards.
cards.flavor: "Wisdom is not the counting of all the drops in a waterfall. Wisdom is learning why the water seeks the earth."
cards.originalText: Draw two cards.

cards.name: Crafty Pathmage
cards.text: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.
cards.flavor:
Follow the pathmage
—Otarian expression meaning
"escape quickly"

rulings.text: If you increase the power of the targeted creature after the ability resolves, it still can't be blocked that turn.

cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less is unblockable this turn.

cards.name: Dehydration
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
cards.flavor: The viashino used the spell to dry foods for crossing the Great Desert. The Suq'Ata later discovered its use in war.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

cards.name: Deluge
cards.text: Tap all creatures without flying.
cards.flavor:
"From the sea came all life, and to the sea it will return. The sooner the better."
—Emperor Aboshan
cards.originalText: Tap all creatures without flying.

cards.name: Denizen of the Deep
cards.text: When Denizen of the Deep enters the battlefield, return each other creature you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: According to merfolk legend, a denizen of the deep swallows the horizon at the end of each day, bringing on the cold blanket of night.
cards.originalText: When Denizen of the Deep comes into play, return each other creature you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Discombobulate
cards.text: Counter target spell. Look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
cards.flavor:
"I said 'pick his brain,' not 'tear off his head.'"
—Riptide Project researcher
cards.originalText: Counter target spell. Look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

cards.name: Dreamborn Muse
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player puts the top X cards of their library into their graveyard, where X is the number of cards in their hand.
cards.flavor:
"Her voice is insight, piercing and true."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor
cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard, where X is the number of cards in his or her hand.

cards.name: Evacuation
cards.text: Return all creatures to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor:
"Once I supply the breeze, you'll see your warriors for the smoke they truly are."
—Alexi, zephyr mage
cards.originalText: Return all creatures to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Flashfreeze
cards.text: Counter target red or green spell.
cards.flavor:
"Nature? Fire? Bah! Both are chaotic and difficult to control. Ice is structured, latticed, light as a feather, massive as a glacier. In ice, there is power!"
—Heidar, Rimewind master
cards.originalText: Counter target red or green spell.

cards.name: Fog Elemental
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Fog Elemental attacks or blocks, sacrifice it at end of combat.
cards.flavor:
"It's the perfect sentry. Those who should pass can go right through it."
—Teferi
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Fog Elemental attacks or blocks, sacrifice it at end of combat.

cards.name: Fugitive Wizard
cards.flavor:
"The law has its place—as a footnote in my spellbook."
—Siyani, fugitive mage

cards.name: Horseshoe Crab
cards.text: {U}: Untap Horseshoe Crab.
cards.flavor:
"Hmm . . . It looks kinda like a bug. Let's crack it open an' see if it tastes like one!"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand
cards.originalText: {U}: Untap Horseshoe Crab.

cards.name: Hurkyl's Recall
cards.text: Return all artifacts target player owns to their hand.
cards.flavor: Hurkyl's research at the College of Lat-Nam wasn't enough to stop the two brothers, but for centuries thereafter her spellcraft taught artificers restraint.

rulings.text: Retrieves all artifacts owned by the target player regardless of who controls them. Ignores artifacts owned by other players even if target player has control of them.
It only returns artifacts which are on the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Return all artifacts target player owns to his or her hand.

cards.name: Lumengrid Warden
cards.flavor: The wardens keep watch over an endless sea of progress.

foreignNames.name: ルーメングリッドの管理人

cards.name: Mahamoti Djinn
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.
cards.originalText: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.name: March of the Machines
cards.text: Each noncreature artifact is an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. (Equipment that's a creature can't equip a creature.)

rulings.text: If a noncreature artifact is also another card type, such as enchantment or land, it will retain those types in addition to being an artifact creature.

If an Equipment becomes a creature, it can no longer equip a creature. If it's currently attached to a creature, it becomes unattached (but remains on the battlefield). You can activate the Equipment's equip ability, but it won't do anything.
Each artifact land has a converted mana cost of 0. March of the Machines makes them 0/0 creatures, which are put into the graveyard as a state-based action.

If a noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature this way and then another effect animates it, the new effect overrides March of the Machines's effect. For example, Chimeric Staff is a 4/4 creature while March of the Machines is on the battlefield. If you activate Chimeric Staff's ability and choose X = 5, Chimeric Staff will be a 5/5 artifact creature for the rest of the turn.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn.

cards.originalText: Each noncreature artifact is an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. (Equipment that's a creature can't equip a creature.)

cards.name: Merfolk Looter
cards.text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.flavor:
It belongs to the merfolk now.
—Shipwreck prayer

rulings.text: You can't do anything in between drawing a card and discarding a card, including casting or cycling the card you drew.

foreignNames.name: マーフォークの物あさり

cards.originalText: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.

cards.name: Mind Bend
cards.text: Change the text of target permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another or one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "nonblack creature" to "nongreen creature" or "forestwalk" to "islandwalk." This effect lasts indefinitely.)
cards.flavor:
"The world, I've come to realize, is a blank canvas on which to paint."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor

rulings.text: Alters all occurrences of the chosen word in the text box and the type line of the given card.
Can target a card with no appropriate words on it, or even one with no words at all.
It can't change a word to the same word. It must be a different word.
It only changes what is printed on the card (or set on a token when it was created or set by a copy effect). It will not change any effects that are on the permanent.
You choose the words to change on resolution.
You can't change proper nouns (i.e. card names) such as "Island Fish Jasconius".
It can be used to change a land's type from one basic land type to another. For example, Forest can be changed to Island so it produces blue mana. It doesn't change the name of any permanent.

cards.originalText: Change the text of target permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another or one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "nonblack creature" to "nongreen creature" or "forestwalk" to "islandwalk." This effect doesn't end at end of turn.)

cards.name: Peek
cards.text:
Look at target player's hand.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Sometimes you have to read between the minds.
cards.originalText:
Look at target player's hand.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Persuasion
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
You control enchanted creature.
cards.flavor: There's no telling what an accomplished mage might collect.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
You control enchanted creature.

cards.name: Phantom Warrior
cards.text: Phantom Warrior can't be blocked.
cards.flavor:
"There are as many pillows of illusion as flakes in a snow-storm. We wake from one dream into another dream."
—Ralph Waldo Emerson, "Illusions"
cards.originalText: Phantom Warrior is unblockable.

cards.name: Plagiarize
cards.text: Until end of turn, if target player would draw a card, instead that player skips that draw and you draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Are you thinking what I'm thinking?"

rulings.text: If you target yourself, this spell has no useful effect. It will not cause an infinite loop since a replacement effect can't modify the same event more than once. This effect will not modify the draw that it has you perform.
You draw the card from your library as normal, not from your opponent's library.

If you and your opponent each cast Plagiarize on each other during the same turn, the two spells effectively cancel each other out. You will draw cards when you normally would and so will your opponent.

If you target a player whose library is empty, any effect or turn-based action that would cause that player to draw a card will cause you to draw a card instead. It doesn't matter that the other player would be unable to draw.

cards.originalText: Until end of turn, if target player would draw a card, instead that player skips that draw and you draw a card.

cards.name: Puppeteer
cards.text: {U}, {T}: You may tap or untap target creature.
cards.flavor:
"That's the funny thing about free will. You don't feel any different without it."
—Ambassador Laquatus

rulings.text: You decide on resolution whether or not to tap or untap the creature.

cards.originalText: {U}, {T}: You may tap or untap target creature.

cards.name: Reminisce
cards.text: Target player shuffles their graveyard into their library.
cards.flavor: Leave the door to the past even slightly ajar and it could be blown off its hinges.

rulings.text: This card won't be put into your graveyard until after it's finished resolving, which means it won't be shuffled into your library as part of its own effect.

cards.originalText: Target player shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.

cards.name: Remove Soul
cards.text: Counter target creature spell.
cards.flavor: When your enemies are denied soldiers, they are denied victory.

rulings.text: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

cards.originalText: Counter target creature spell.

cards.name: Robe of Mirrors
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor:
"Some say you cannot hit what you cannot see. I prefer that you hit what I want you to see."
—Arcanis the Omnipotent

rulings.text: Having shroud will prevent the creature from being targeted by Aura spells, but it does not remove any Auras that are already attached to the creature or stop Auras from being moved to the creature by some other method.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.name: Rootwater Commando
cards.text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
cards.flavor: Rootwater merfolk are seldom seen these days, but elf corpses are as numerous as ever.

foreignNames.name: ルートウォーターの猛士

cards.originalText: Islandwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls an Island.)

cards.name: Rootwater Matriarch
cards.text: {T}: Gain control of target creature for as long as that creature is enchanted.
cards.flavor: In the harsh depths of Rootwater, the charms of surface dwellers are quite useless . . . except as lures.

rulings.text: Can target an unenchanted creature but has no effect on that creature.
A creature is "enchanted" if it has any Auras attached to it.
Unlike many similar creatures, Rootwater Matriarch untaps as normal during your untap step. Whether it's tapped or untapped has no bearing on the control-change effect.

The control effect applies so long as at least one Aura is attached to the creature, and will continue to apply even if Rootwater Matriarch has left the battlefield. The effect ends if at any time the creature has no Auras on it.

foreignNames.name: ルートウォーターの女族長

cards.originalText: {T}: Gain control of target creature as long as that creature is enchanted.

cards.name: Sage Owl
cards.text:
Flying
When Sage Owl enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Sage Owl comes into play, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

cards.name: Scalpelexis
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Scalpelexis deals combat damage to a player, that player exiles the top four cards of their library. If two or more of those cards have the same name, repeat this process.

rulings.text: The "repeat this process" means to repeat as often as it takes to not get a matching pair.

cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Scalpelexis deals combat damage to a player, that player removes the top four cards of his or her library from the game. If two or more of those cards have the same name, repeat this process.

cards.name: Sea Monster
cards.text: Sea Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
cards.flavor: It's easy to believe the monster is a myth—until you feel three hundred thousand pounds of myth crashing down on your ship.
cards.originalText: Sea Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

cards.name: Shimmering Wings
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has flying. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{U}: Return Shimmering Wings to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"I leave words like 'impossible' to the rabble. Whatever I imagine, I can create."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has flying. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{U}: Return Shimmering Wings to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Sift
cards.text: Draw three cards, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: Dwell longest on the thoughts that shine brightest.
cards.originalText: Draw three cards, then discard a card.

cards.name: Sky Weaver
cards.text: {2}: Target white or black creature gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: "Let my wisdom give you wings."
cards.originalText: {2}: Target white or black creature gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.name: Snapping Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: The irritable drakes are solitary nesters. Even brooding females barely contain the urge to attack their own young.
cards.originalText: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.name: Spiketail Hatchling
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Sacrifice Spiketail Hatchling: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
cards.flavor: It dodges waves of water to prepare for waves of magic.

rulings.text: The spell's controller gets the option to pay when this ability resolves.

cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Sacrifice Spiketail Hatchling: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.

cards.name: Sunken Hope
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player returns a creature they control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"I don't concern myself with my enemy's hopes. Hopes follow the tides. They will retreat soon enough."
—Ambassador Laquatus
cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player returns a creature he or she controls to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Telepathy
cards.text: Your opponents play with their hands revealed.
cards.flavor:
"The question isn't whether I can read minds. It's whether I have yet to find a mind worth reading."
—Ambassador Laquatus
cards.originalText: Your opponents play with their hands revealed.

cards.name: Telling Time
cards.text: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of those cards into your hand, one on top of your library, and one on the bottom of your library.
cards.flavor: Mastery is achieved when "telling time" becomes "telling time what to do."

rulings.text: If there are fewer than three cards in your library, follow the instructions in the order given for any cards that are there.

cards.originalText: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of those cards into your hand, one on top of your library, and one on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Thieving Magpie
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Thieving Magpie deals damage to an opponent, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Other birds collect twigs for their nests. Magpies collect jewels for theirs.
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.) 
Whenever Thieving Magpie deals damage to an opponent, you draw a card.

cards.name: Tidings
cards.text: Draw four cards.
cards.flavor:
"Though the letter was many pages long, I could tell all I needed to know from one look at the messenger's face."
—Barrin, master wizard
cards.originalText: Draw four cards.

cards.name: Time Stop
cards.text: End the turn. (Exile all spells and abilities on the stack, including this card. The player whose turn it is discards down to their maximum hand size. Damage wears off, and "this turn" and "until end of turn" effects end.)

rulings.text: Exiling a spell or ability prevents that spell or ability from resolving, but it doesn't technically "counter" anything. This means that Time Stop can exile spells and abilities that "can't be countered."

Unless Time Stop is cast during the Ending phase, any "at the beginning of the end step"-triggered abilities don't get the chance to trigger on the turn Time Stop is cast. These abilities will trigger at the beginning of the next end step.

Ending the turn this way means the following things happen in order: 1) All spells and abilities on the stack are exiled. This includes Time Stop, though it will continue to resolve. It also includes spells and abilities that can't be countered. 2) All attacking and blocking creatures are removed from combat. 3) State-based actions are checked. No player gets priority, and no triggered abilities are put onto the stack. 4) The current phase and/or step ends. The game skips straight to the cleanup step. The cleanup step happens in its entirety.

If any triggered abilities do trigger during this process, they're put onto the stack during the cleanup step. If this happens, players will have a chance to cast spells and activate abilities, then there will be another cleanup step before the turn finally ends.

cards.originalText: End the turn. (Remove all spells and abilities on the stack from the game, including this card. The player whose turn it is discards down to his or her maximum hand size. Damage wears off, and "this turn" and "until end of turn" effects end.)

cards.name: Time Stretch
cards.text: Target player takes two extra turns after this one.
cards.flavor: There's lots of time like the present.

rulings.text: If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

cards.originalText: Target player takes two extra turns after this one.

cards.name: Traumatize
cards.text: Target player puts the top half of their library, rounded down, into their graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"The educated mind is heavy with lore and knowledge. It's also the most likely to collapse under its own weight."
—Ambassador Laquatus

rulings.text: The player can put the cards in their graveyard in any order they choose.

cards.originalText: Target player puts the top half of his or her library, rounded down, into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Twincast
cards.text: Copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
cards.flavor: Imitation is the most dangerous form of flattery.

rulings.text: You can't choose to pay any additional costs for the copy. However, effects based on any additional costs paid for the targeted spell are copied as though those same costs were paid for the copy too.
Twincast copies any text spliced onto the targeted spell, but you can't splice additional text onto the copy.
Twincast can target (and copy) any instant or sorcery spell, not just one with targets. It doesn't matter who controls it.

As Twincast resolves, it creates a copy of a spell. That copy is created on the stack, so it's not "cast." Abilities that trigger when a player casts a spell won't trigger. The copy will then resolve like a normal spell, after players get a chance to cast spells and activate abilities.

The copy will have the same targets as the spell it's copying unless you choose new ones. You may change any number of the targets, including all of them or none of them. If, for one of the targets, you can't choose a new legal target, then it remains unchanged (even if the current target is illegal).
If the spell Twincast copies is modal (that is, it says "Choose one —" or the like), the copy will have the same mode. You can't choose a different one.
If the spell Twincast copies has an X whose value was determined as it was cast (like Earthquake does), the copy has the same value of X.

If the copy says that it affects "you," it affects the controller of the copy, not the controller of the original spell. Similarly, if the copy says that it affects an "opponent," it affects an opponent of the copy's controller, not an opponent of the original spell's controller.

cards.originalText: Copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.

cards.name: Twitch
cards.text:
You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Battles are won in nuance.

rulings.text: If the targeted permanent is an illegal target by the time Twitch resolves, the entire spell doesn't resolve. You don't draw a card.

cards.originalText:
You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Unsummon
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Tolarian apprentices learn to liberate Ætheric energy long before they are taught to bind it.
cards.originalText: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Vedalken Mastermind
cards.text: {U}, {T}: Return target permanent you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: The vedalken see other beings from a cold distance, as either experimental subjects or objects of study.
cards.originalText: {U}, {T}: Return target permanent you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Wall of Air
cards.text: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor:
When no falcons fly, beware the sky.
—Femeref aphorism
cards.originalText: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Afflict
cards.text:
Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: One rarely notices a heartbeat, save when it is stolen.
cards.originalText:
Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Agonizing Memories
cards.text: Look at target player's hand and choose two cards from it. Put them on top of that player's library in any order.
cards.flavor: In the aftermath of war, when the slaying is long done, the greatest miseries come home to roost.
cards.originalText: Look at target player's hand and choose two cards from it. Put them on top of that player's library in any order.

cards.name: Ascendant Evincar
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Other black creatures get +1/+1.
Nonblack creatures get -1/-1.
cards.flavor: His soul snared by an angel's curse, Crovax twisted heroism into its purest shadow.

rulings.text: If Ascendant Evincar stops being black, it gives itself -1/-1.

foreignNames.name: 隆盛なるエヴィンカー

cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Other black creatures get +1/+1. 
Nonblack creatures get -1/-1.

cards.name: Assassinate
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.flavor:
"This is how wars are won—not with armies of soldiers but with a single knife blade, artfully placed."
—Yurin, royal assassin
cards.originalText: Destroy target tapped creature.

cards.name: Beacon of Unrest
cards.text: Put target artifact or creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. Shuffle Beacon of Unrest into its owner's library.
cards.flavor: A vertical scream pierces the night air and echoes doom through the clouds.

rulings.text: If a Beacon is countered or doesn't resolve, it's put into its owner's graveyard, not shuffled into the library.

cards.originalText: Put target artifact or creature card in a graveyard into play under your control. Shuffle Beacon of Unrest into its owner's library.

cards.name: Bog Wraith
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: Knowing Takenuma Swamp to be dangerous, Hisata set wards to warn him of predators. He never imagined that his murderer would pass through them unhindered.
cards.originalText: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

cards.name: Consume Spirit
cards.text:
Spend only black mana on X.
Consume Spirit deals X damage to any target and you gain X life.
cards.flavor:
"Your blood, your marrow, your spirit—all are mine."
—Mayvar, minion of Geth

rulings.text: The amount of life you gain is equal to the number chosen for X, not the amount of damage Consume Spirit deals (in case some of it is prevented).
If the targeted permanent or player is an illegal target by the time Consume Spirit would resolve, the entire spell doesn't resolve. You won't gain any life.

cards.originalText:
Spend only black mana on X.
Consume Spirit deals X damage to target creature or player and you gain X life.

cards.name: Contaminated Bond
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature attacks or blocks, its controller loses 3 life.
cards.flavor:
"My favorite curses are those that manifest slowly, blackening the soul in ways the victim cannot hope to understand."
—Erissa, bog witch
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature attacks or blocks, its controller loses 3 life.

cards.name: Cruel Edict
cards.text: Target opponent sacrifices a creature.
cards.flavor:
"Choose your next words carefully. They will be your last."
—Phage the Untouchable
cards.originalText: Target opponent sacrifices a creature.

cards.name: Deathmark
cards.text: Destroy target green or white creature.
cards.flavor:
"I hope it's true that every snowflake is unique, because I never want to see one like this again. Now clean up that body."
—Thangbrand Gyrdsson, Kjeldoran patrol
cards.originalText: Destroy target green or white creature.

cards.name: Diabolic Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: The best ideas often come from the worst minds.
cards.originalText: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Distress
cards.text: Target player reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor:
"They say the eyes are the windows to the soul. I like to break windows and take what's inside."
—Braids, dementia summoner

rulings.text: If you target yourself with this spell, you must reveal your entire hand to the other players just as any other player would.

cards.originalText: Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Doomed Necromancer
cards.text: {B}, {T}, Sacrifice Doomed Necromancer: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Many necromancers share the same last words—the ones that conclude the undeath ritual.

foreignNames.name: 宿命のネクロマンサー

cards.originalText: {B}, {T}, Sacrifice Doomed Necromancer: Return target creature card from your graveyard to play.

cards.name: Dross Crocodile
cards.flavor:
"As soon as it surfaced, we could all smell it. Its rancid breath reeked of half-digested carrion and its own rotting innards."
—Dafri, Auriok champion

foreignNames.name: ドロスのクロコダイル

cards.name: Drudge Skeletons
cards.text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor:
"The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, never surrender, and don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."
—Nevinyrral, Necromancer's Handbook
cards.originalText: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.name: Dusk Imp
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Imps are just intelligent enough to have an understanding of cruelty.
cards.originalText: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.name: Essence Drain
cards.text: Essence Drain deals 3 damage to any target and you gain 3 life.
cards.flavor:
"The elves are right: Death inevitably leads to life. But the truly powerful don't just experience this cycle. They control it."
—Crovax, ascendant evincar

rulings.text: If the target permanent or player is an illegal target when Essence Drain tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won't gain 3 life.

cards.originalText: Essence Drain deals 3 damage to target creature or player and you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Fear
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.flavor:
"Even the bravest of warriors yet knows the dark clutch of fright upon his stalwart heart."
—Lim-Dûl the Necromancer
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

cards.name: Festering Goblin
cards.text: When Festering Goblin dies, target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: In life, it was a fetid, disease-ridden thing. In death, not much changed.
cards.originalText: When Festering Goblin is put into a graveyard from play, target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Grave Pact
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control dies, each other player sacrifices a creature.
cards.flavor:
"The bonds of loyalty can tie one to the grave."
—Crovax, ascendant evincar

rulings.text: Each other player sacrifices a creature for each creature you control that goes to a graveyard.

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature you control is put into a graveyard from play, each other player sacrifices a creature.

cards.name: Graveborn Muse
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you draw X cards and you lose X life, where X is the number of Zombies you control.
cards.flavor:
"Her voice is damnation, unyielding and certain."
—Phage the Untouchable
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, you draw X cards and you lose X life, where X is the number of Zombies you control.

cards.name: Gravedigger
cards.text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.

rulings.text: A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.originalText: When Gravedigger comes into play, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Hate Weaver
cards.text: {2}: Target blue or red creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Let my hate fuel your fury."
cards.originalText: {2}: Target blue or red creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Head Games
cards.text: Target opponent puts the cards from their hand on top of their library. Search that player's library for that many cards. The player puts those cards into their hand, then shuffles their library.
cards.originalText: Target opponent puts the cards from his or her hand on top of his or her library. Search that player's library for that many cards. The player puts those cards into his or her hand, then shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Hidden Horror
cards.text: When Hidden Horror enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a creature card.
cards.flavor: If the presence of evil were obvious, it wouldn't be nearly as dangerous.

rulings.text: When the ability resolves, you choose whether to sacrifice the creature or perform the other action. If you can't perform the other action, then you must sacrifice the creature.
If the creature is no longer on the battlefield when the ability resolves, you may still perform the action if you want.

cards.originalText: When Hidden Horror comes into play, sacrifice it unless you discard a creature card.

cards.name: Highway Robber
cards.text: When Highway Robber enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: "Tonight, madam, it's your money and your life."
cards.originalText: When Highway Robber comes into play, you gain 2 life and target opponent loses 2 life.

cards.name: Hypnotic Specter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.
cards.flavor: Its victims are known by their eyes: shattered vessels leaking broken dreams.

rulings.text: The ability triggers even if the Specter's damage is being redirected to an opponent. It does not trigger if damage that would have been dealt to the opponent is redirected to a nonopponent player or a creature, or if the damage is prevented.

cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.

cards.name: Knight of Dusk
cards.text: {B}{B}: Destroy target creature blocking Knight of Dusk.
cards.flavor: "Challenge me with your strongest. I will paint my sword with their blood."
cards.originalText: {B}{B}: Destroy target creature blocking Knight of Dusk.

cards.name: Looming Shade
cards.text: {B}: Looming Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Its form never rests, propelled by some undetectable gale from beyond the gloom.
cards.originalText: {B}: Looming Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
